conclusion: The v-t (velocity-time) graph shows the velocity of the particle as a function of time.
Velocity is a vector quantity that indicates both speed and direction.
A positive velocity means the particle is moving in the direction considered positive.
A negative velocity means the particle is moving in the direction opposite to the positive direction.
From the graph, observe the velocity values between t = 2 seconds and t = 3 seconds.
At t = 2 seconds, the velocity is 0 m/s.
Between t = 2 seconds and t = 3 seconds, the velocity becomes increasingly negative, reaching -2 m/s at t = 3 seconds.

premise: Since the velocity is negative during this interval.
conclusion: The particle is moving in the direction opposite to the defined positive direction.

premise: The fact that the velocity decreases from 0 m/s to -2 m/s.
conclusion: It is indeed moving in the negative direction.

premise: The motion direction of the particle from 2 to 3 seconds is opposite to the defined positive direction.
conclusion: Therefore, it is opposite to the prescribed positive direction.
